All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AdaptiveMbRobot
A robot with a differential drive that looks like a Makeblock-robot (super class) and an artificial neural network as a "brain" that can be generated from a given "Genome".
Apple
Target object class "Apple".
Bullet
A bullet that can hit rocks (not used).
Cursor
Cursor for selecting robots to watch their state.
Explosion
An explosion.
GeneticAlgorithm
GeneticAlgorithm is used to train neuron network.
Genome
Genome object simply keeps 2 important info: fitness and weights.
GlassPane
The GlassPane is used to augment the screen wit additional informations or visualizations (sensor beams, fps, states, results, ...).
GlassPane.Mode
The two possbile FPS display modes the calculation can take.
IntegerVec2D
Helps to process 2D integer vectors.
JfxMonitor
With this tool, states and data can be displayed "live" and compared with previous series.
MakeblockRobot
A robot with differential drive that looks like a Makeblock-robot.
MbRobotMotors
Class for simulated Makeblock(TM) robot components that receive motor outputs (see the kinematics method).
MbRobotSensors
Definition of the MbRobotSensors.
MbRobotSensors4
Definition of the MbRobotSensors with 4 distance sensors.
Motors
Abstract class for robot components that receive motor outputs (see the kinematics method).
Mushroom
Target object class "Mushroom".
NeuralNetwork
A fully connected Neural Network (Multilayer Perceptron).
Rock
Smooth moving rock (not used).
Sensors
Abstract class for robot components that supply sensory input.
ShowRewardCollect
Displays collected reward.
SmoothMover
A variation of an actor that maintains precise location (using doubles for the co-ordinates instead of ints).
Targets
Abstract class of "target" objects where the bots can get "rewards".
Tester
 
ToolKit
Supplementary material to the book: "Reinforcement Learning From Scratch: Understanding Current Approaches - with Examples in Java and Greenfoot" by Uwe Lorenz.
Vector
A 2D vector.
